column4: The bug report already has the instructions to fix the issue.
can you please give me the link? I couldnt find it myself
Please make sure you're on the right channel if you need to do that again.
Yes. Maverick updates/security is up to 2.6.35-25.44
all right, thanks, I was just wondering 'cos I got a message saying I was updated from an untrusted source or whatever, didnt upgrade then but now im being adventerous and upgrading wirelessly o_O
More likely because you failed to 'apt-get update' properly, try it again.
i didnt get the same error again, probably 'cos I did an apt-get update some time ago, Im upgrading now, hopefully it'll work after I reboot o_O
so start up screen then control A, then start the command, then control-D ?
No.  Use ctrl-a to enter the mode where you can enter screen commands.  'd' is the key to detatch from screen.  See ctrl-a then '?' for help
ahhh so you can help me with flash on my laptop then?
Lmat: It is initially defined in /etc/environment, but for adding to it for yourself, you should add a PATH=/new/path:$PATH to your own .bashrc (or relevant $SHELL config file)
